content: The default Taxonomy Term view with path /taxonomy/term/% (initially disabled) is for customising how nodes are displayed when viewing a term page. How does one go about customising node displays on term pages differently depending on the vocabulary? For example, say I have a 'Country' vocab and I want nodes on Country term pages displayed as a table, but I also have a 'Tags' vocab and I want nodes on Tag term pages displayed as teasers... How would I do that?
My initial thought is to use two displays of that view, each with a Vocabulary filter. But I don't believe they can both have the same path (/taxonomy/term/%) right?

Second thought is to use Layouts to do this somehow (haven't played with layouts too much to know off-hand how to do that however). But then I wonder why we have a disabled Taxonomy Term view instead of a disabled Taxonomy Term layout...
I haven't done this either, but my first reaction was also layouts + visibility conditions ...but I only see visibility conditions for terms - not for vocabularies :thinking:

Looked up similar question for D7 and suggestions seemed to be to use Panels/Page manager (i.e. Layouts in Backdrop). But my problem with that is I'd then essentially have a copy of all regions (header, top, sidebar, bottom, footer, etc.), just to change the contents of the Content region. So if anything in the header, footer, etc. ever changed, that's all the more places I'd need to update (unnecessarily IMO).

I feel you @BWPanda :sweat: ...see #1691, #1886 and all other issues mentioned there.

[UX] Layout UI: Collapsible block groups. · Issue #1691 · backdrop/backdrop-issues

My Front layout has exactly the same header and footer as my Default layout, it's just the Content that's different (and the template). But I currently have to make any changes to the heade...

I keep forgetting to try this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/copy_blocks

backdrop-contrib/copy_blocks
Add blocks to your layout which are actually copies of other blocks or entire regions. - backdrop-contrib/copy_blocks

... my first reaction was also layouts + visibility conditions ...but I only see visibility conditions for terms - not for vocabularies :thinking:

In a Layout with Path / Context taxonomy/term/%, it should be possible to choose a vocabulary as visibility condition.
You're absolutely right @Olaf Grabienski :+1: ...my bad.

@BWPanda Also, https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/disable_term_node_listings might be interesting for you.

backdrop-contrib/disable_term_node_listings
Selectively disable content listings per vocabulary. - backdrop-contrib/disable_term_node_listings
I use Copy Blocks in cases where I need to mirror regions from another layout. It works well.
But disabling the default listing on certain vocabularies and rebuilding it with views blocks (and visibility conditions) is another good option in this case.

BWPanda said:

Second thought is to use Layouts to do this somehow (haven't played with layouts too much to know off-hand how to do that however). But then I wonder why we have a disabled Taxonomy Term view instead of a disabled Taxonomy Term layout...

@BWPanda, in D7 there's a module called taxonomy term view or taxonomy term profile(or something like that) that allows you to assign a specific view to a term. I've used it in both D6 and D7. Maybe something worth porting?
